official_title: A bill to amend titles II and XVI of the Social Security Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue the Secretary's final decision, after certain hearings required thereunder, within 90 days after commencing proceedings before the Appeals Council in the Department of Health and Human Services.
short_title: Department of Health and Human Services Appeals Council Limitations Act of 1985
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services
Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Department of Health and Human Services Appeals Council Limitations Act of 1985 - Amends titles II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) and XVI (Supplemental Security Income) of the Social Security Act to direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue a final decision within 90 days after the commencement of proceedings before the Appeals Council in the Department of Health and Human Services. Deems the issues resolved in the person's favor if the Secretary fails to meet such requirement.

titles.title: Department of Health and Human Services Appeals Council Limitations Act of 1985

A bill to amend titles II and XVI of the Social Security Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue the Secretary's final decision, after certain hearings required thereunder, within 90 days after commencing proceedings before the Appeals Council in the Department of Health and Human Services.
